I have already discussed with Committee Chairmen a three-year rotational basis
for committee appointments. Because of some reservations, I was not able to
put this into effect — except spottily — this year. The objective is, of
course, to preserve continuity and yet involve new people each year. It is
still under consideration* I'd like your reactions to it.
What I would like to have from every NAEB member. Is:
— Any general comment you would be good enough to give us on possible new
committees needed, others which might be deleted or combined, or other
useful overall suggestions,
— An indication of the kind of committee or special assignment you feel you
would be interested in. (incidentally several people were this year left
off committees because I hope, during the year, to call upon them for spe¬
cial projects of one kind or another.)
— Suggestions of other good people we are not now using who would be willing
and able to assist in committee work (with an indication of their special
interests).
It will require constant thought and effort to make next year's committee
selections even more appropriate than this year's — of which I think we can
be generally proud.
We are sincere about this. Any of you who know the scores of hours of effort
and soul-searching that goes into committee appointments, can attest to this.
But we all need ideas and suggestions.
Won't you take the time to give them to us? Thanks very much.
HJS:jp
